messages.subject: Side thought (was getting over fears)
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/22/04 9:29:30 PM, kpacklight@gmail.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/22/04 9:29:30 PM, kpacklight@... writes:

<< So, like one candle lighting
> another the ideas from this list have spread into our family's life and
> "lit it up". >>

There has been pressure from odd corners (off the list) for a new term for
unschooling that steps beyond anything academic. Maybe
"Unschooling Light."

I keep thinking of names in my head, but each one makes the other/non seems
less than.

Unschooling Light would make them seem like the real, whole, unschooling.

And the "Light" could ne not less heavy, but less dark. (Well, less heavy AND
less dark.)

I love ambiguity. It makes language and thought so three-dimensional.

Sandra
